                                \_/
Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Nov 22 12:46:16 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

web address.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a small white trash bin, a compact white refrigerator, a compact
red refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container, a blue plastic food
storage container, and Magellan the arachnoid security robot here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark purple tee appliqued with small gold
dragonflies, a pair of skinny white low rise jeans, and a pair of mystic purple
suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her
wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved
with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst
crystals, a light purple flightbag with a pastel kitten on the side, a soft
fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria', a metallic gold touch
einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and a Tardick
lizard named Asteria perched on her shoulder. Her head, face, both eyes, neck,
both wrists, both hands, and waist are left uncovered.
She is carrying a large crystal gold-trimmed goblet of Cape Myers Paradise
Vineyards Extra-Dry Prosecco in her right hand.

       /    ____/ **                         **|___     ___|
       |   /     **                           **   |   |
       |   |    _____ _____ _____ _   _ _____ _____|   |

                               | |_
                               | | |
                                \_/
Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.

We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

l
[Starship "Striking Distance"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair and a wormhole drive tracer here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go up and out.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Striking Distance, you have clearance
to launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark purple tee appliqued with small gold
dragonflies, a pair of skinny white low rise jeans, and a pair of mystic purple
suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet
around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her
wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved
with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst
crystals, a light purple flightbag with a pastel kitten on the side, a soft
fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria', a metallic gold touch
einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and a Tardick
lizard named Asteria perched on her shoulder. Her head, face, both eyes, neck,
both wrists, both hands, and waist are left uncovered.
She is carrying a large crystal gold-trimmed goblet of Cape Myers Paradise
Vineyards Extra-Dry Prosecco in her right hand.

Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.

contact!

[Starship "Striking Distance"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a black leather captain's chair and a wormhole drive tracer here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go up and out.
The damage control computer reports, "Repair of the hull has been completed by
the spaceport."
You hear hammering and the chatter of technicians outside as the spaceport
repairs the starship.
The damage control computer reports, "Repair of light turret #4 has been
completed by the spaceport."
You hear hammering and the chatter of technicians outside as the spaceport
repairs the starship.
Lily Kaise glides in from below.

Lily Kaise kisses you.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and

small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a small white trash bin, a compact red refrigerator, a clear
plastic food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, Magellan

l
[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The two-person light transport "Lots Of Debris Stored Here" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, and a sanitation drone
here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
A sanitation drone turns and slowly plods into a transparisteel doorway into the
pilot lounge.

You gesture vaguely at the two-person light transport "Lots Of Debris Stored
Here".
Lily Kaise nods.

ftl accord
The ship is already moving.
ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
move
AutoStar detects 2 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.
--
AutoStar (general-purpose starship autopilot) Version 9.1
--
Destinations in this sector:
   Space Stations:
[1] AFW Command (Dock One)              
[2] AFW Command (Dock Two)              
[3] AFW Command (Dock Three)            
[4] AFW Command (Dock Four)             
   Beacon Housings:
[5] Beacon ACC-01                       
--
Enter your destination:
Via general sector communication, Accord of Free Worlds Command transmits,
"Hello, Striking Distance. Welcome to Accord space."
3
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: AFW Command (Dock
Three).
Would you like to request docking clearance for AFW Command (Dock Three)?
[Enter `yes' or `no']

[Starship "Striking Distance"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay
Three.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole drive tracer, and a decoy
beacon launcher here.
You can go up and out.
sit chair
You sit down on a black leather captain's chair.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
Flight control gives the ship launch clearance.

The ship is already moving.

bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

in greens and blues with pure white clouds.

[Starship "Justen Moon"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.

[1] The Shoulder of Orion (Unclaimed)
[2] The Belt of Orion (Unclaimed)
Enter your selection:
2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
q||9d[.iV]1Jl1WycE2hgMHkcw%l7ycP5DX?4g)a
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Hello!"
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Justen Moon.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

FTL Interalliance Communications Network
--
Subject: Time to practice what we preach
Author: Kim Saunders
Posted: 20:01 24 November 2316 GST
--
Hello all,
Although our meeting ended rather abruptly and after a rough and serious
conversation, I generally do think it was productive. I thank everyone for
attending and for your input and cooperation.
It is time that we try to move on now. Lily has appologized for her decision not
to return home once she learned the news, and unless she gives us a new reason
to doubt the sincerity of her words, we should leave it at that. Our statement
has also made the news. For anyone who was not in the meeting, we decided to
send the following messages in our statement.
1. A message of support and condolences to the victims and their families.
2. A call for peace and understanding, a call for the AEU citizens who are
involved in these acts of violence to stop what they are doing and think things
through. The hope that we can solve differences by communicating rather than
attacking and killing people.
3. We also put our support behind the statement the League, Fringe and Mutuality
pilots released earlier, and we expressed the hope that the people responsible
will be found and brought to justice.
I know it's been a tough week, and things were said that we all may regret. I
know that even I have said things, in anger and frustration, that I probably
could have worded differently, and I appologize for this. What matters now is
that we try to find common ground again from which we can move on and work
together. How can we preach peace and understanding when we are at each other's
throats? I hope we can all let past animosities go and turn a new leaf.
Then there is another thing I would like to address. Ather, I know you are not
fond of felo and see them as tools. I am not here to start another felo
discussion. no, i am not fond of what some people do to felo, you are not the
only one. we will probably never agree on the subject. It is up to the lawyers
and other such people to define whether felo should be treated the same as all
animals, and whether mutilating and killing them is a punishable offense or not.
But it is a hot topic among pilots from all alliances. I think it is walking a
very thin line when you openly defend felo mutilation.
I agree whole heartedly with a notice I received today from the liaison office.
If we on one hand preach cooperation,love, understanding and peace, and on the
other hand publicly argue with each other, attack each other, threaten each
other or state that animal mutilation is ok, we are contradicting ourselves. It
will send a very wrong signal and will give people even less a reason to trust
us. Now, I don't know who threatened who, this was just something the liaison
mentioned. This request is addressed to us all, whether you were at the meeting
or not, and yes, it includes me as well. Let's work together towards our goal of
understanding and peace. I know we can do it!
Take care,
Kim
--

[2] Return
[3] Reply
[4] Quit

A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.

green
You lift a small plastic cover and press a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.
ftl new
The ship must be on autopilot.
auto
A small light next to the word AUTOPILOT switches on, while a similar light next
to the word MANUAL switches off.
ftl new
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Revenge!
Welcome to home space!"

        \______\_____|_| |_\___  |_____|_____|_____|___|
                               | |_
                               | | |
                                \_/
Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Tue Nov 22 12:46:16 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "Revenge"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see an improved temporary wormhole drive, a dark gray leather captain's
chair, and a decoy beacon launcher here.
You can go down and out.
(You are sitting.)
damage
**
 Welcome back to Star Conquest!
**

those costs.
 Type HELP DONATIONS for more information.

 TIP: You can type WHO to see which other pilots are around.

from the various starship systems.

assembly, a portion of a wormhole drive, twelve of an unidentifiable starship
component, twelve of an interior panel, seven of a landing gear strut, and
fourteen of an intact hull plate here.
You can go up.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The one-person fighter "Revenge" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
enter dove
You key in a transport of William Dove to your location.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is slowly brought in
aboard an automated flatbed, then lowered to the floor.
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, an
early warning space defense device, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, and
a small mystic purple bioplastic crate here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter dove
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a small white trash bin, a compact red refrigerator, a clear
plastic food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, Magellan
the arachnoid security robot, and a compact white refrigerator here.
You can go south and out.
sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.
Your ship 'Revenge' has been automatically moved into a garage.
A medium-sized thickly-shelled creature with a red shell and four small claws
grips a plastic wrecked EAOS Defender firmly in its claws, then gives up when it
can't break the toy.

a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing

               worlds and back to where they came from.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold

service robot, a small white trash bin, a compact red refrigerator, a clear
plastic food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, Magellan
the arachnoid security robot, and a compact white refrigerator here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a small white trash bin, a compact red refrigerator, a clear
plastic food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, Magellan
the arachnoid security robot, and a compact white refrigerator here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

buy 10
You order an early warning space defense device.
l device
an early warning space defense device
This is an early warning device which, when left adrift in space, is designed to
alert spacewalking crew when another starship enters the sector. It is a boxy,
bulky device with a plain dark steel casing. Its most prominent feature is a
round transparisteel casing at the top that contains several bright bulbs. A
sealed panel on the side reads, GRAVITON DETECTOR WITHIN. NO USER-SERVICEABLE
PARTS.

[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.
You can go up.

dropped out of communications.

have not recently been active.

[Starship "William Dove"; Base Block]
You see a soft round ocean blue rug with a design of coral and turquoise
seashells, a blueberry rattan bench, a round white rattan dining table with a
glass top, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a rattan floor lamp with a coral lotus shade, a blueberry rattan
pantry cabinet, a small dusky pink trash bin, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo
chow bowl, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a white microwave oven, a long
white and coral pink flowered cushion, Blueberry the hefty violet feathered
felo, and Jewel the large violet glowing felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

[Starship "William Dove"; "Hope"]]
You see a silky electric blue cushion decorated with embroidered pale blue
flowers, a glossy silver ceramic felo chow bowl, a large bubbling azure blue-lit
aquarium containing violet and amber aquatic life and round rocks, and Kiska the
humanoid service robot here.
You can go east.
l aquarium
a large bubbling azure blue-lit aquarium containing violet and amber aquatic
life and round rocks
This is a tank for holding critters!
It is filled with water.
It is open.
Inside it you see a white plastic undersea castle and a plastic wrecked AEU
Soothsayer.
It appears that there are ample food particles in the water.
A short violet soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles, a large
sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with rounded fins, and a small sleek
speckled violet aquatic creature with pentagonal fins are living in it.
That's three creatures, and the tank could probably safely hold twelve more.

round rocks

tiny startlingly humanoid creature with blue skin and violet butterfly-like

wings, a tiny startlingly humanoid creature with crimson skin and violet
butterfly-like wings, and a tiny startlingly humanoid creature with crimson skin
and violet round wings are living in it.
That's five creatures, and it looks pretty crowded.

the arachnoid security robot, and a compact white refrigerator here.

Command: #ticker {name} {commands} {interval in seconds}

         Executes given command every # of seconds.

Comment: You can remove a ticker with the #unticker command.

temporarily increase the hull's resistance to minicannon damage.

It appears to have 40 out of 40 uses remaining.

red
You lift a small plastic cover and press a red button.

green

You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a small white trash bin, a compact red refrigerator, a clear
plastic food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, Magellan
the arachnoid security robot, and a compact white refrigerator here.
You can go south and out.

[Starship "William Dove"; Base Block]

seashells, a blueberry rattan bench, a round white rattan dining table with a
glass top, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a rattan floor lamp with a coral lotus shade, a blueberry rattan
pantry cabinet, a small dusky pink trash bin, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo
chow bowl, a black plastic tray of spider chow, a white microwave oven, a long
white and coral pink flowered cushion, Jewel the large violet glowing felo, and
Blueberry the hefty violet feathered felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.

a blueberry rattan bench
This long rectangular bench is framed in medium-weight rattan washed with
blueberry stain and polished to a satin finish. Curved rattan arches decorate
the bench frame, and the seat is covered with sturdy, tightly woven wicker.

l second bench
a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered cushion on it
This long rectangular bench is framed in medium-weight rattan washed with
blueberry stain and polished to a satin finish. Curved rattan arches decorate
the bench frame, and the seat is covered with sturdy, tightly woven wicker.
On top of it you see a long white and coral pink flowered cushion.

[Starship "William Dove"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see a luxuriously soft oval deep sapphire blue rug with a gold fleur-de-lys
in the center and thick gold fringe, a walnut rocking chair, a glossy dark
violet ceramic felo chow bowl, and a turquoise and coral pink flowered cushion
here.
You can go up and down.
You begin familiarizing yourself with the engineering stations and making
various changes to your liking.
take cushion
You pick up a turquoise and coral pink flowered cushion.
put cushion on rocking
You put a turquoise and coral pink flowered cushion on a walnut rocking chair.

they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a

it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are

Subject: Belt of Orion Salvage/Xeno Station Up Again
Author: Akemi Bando
Posted: 19:45 24 November 2316 GST
--
I've put the station back up. Just as a reminder to everyone, the station runs
on a blast fusion chamber at full load, which means that it burns fuel fast. It
can hold 80,000 units of debris to fuel itself, but it burns through that much
every 22 hours. As long as the station is seeing regular use it's not an issue,
but when we have a lot of people out it is worth being mindful about keeping it
fueled up.
It may help to think of every 3,600 units of debris donated to the station as an
extra hour of life for it.
Should the station run out of fuel, it will go on emergency power. In that case,
whoever is available to take care of it has under an hour to get some debris
transferred to the station so that it can resume normal power mode.
--

[Starship "William Dove"; Engineering Room]
You see a luxuriously soft oval deep sapphire blue rug with a gold fleur-de-lys
in the center and thick gold fringe, a walnut rocking chair with a turquoise and
coral pink flowered cushion on it, a glossy dark violet ceramic felo chow bowl,
and Jewel the large violet glowing felo here.
You can go up and down.
n
You can't go that way.
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see a luxuriously soft oval deep sapphire blue rug with a gold fleur-de-lys
in the center and thick gold fringe, a walnut rocking chair with a turquoise and
coral pink flowered cushion on it, a glossy dark violet ceramic felo chow bowl,
and Jewel the large violet glowing felo here.
You can go up and down.
u
[Starship "William Dove"; Base Block]
You see a soft round ocean blue rug with a design of coral and turquoise
seashells, a blueberry rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered
cushion on it, a round white rattan dining table with a glass top, a blueberry
rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered cushion on it, a rattan
floor lamp with a coral lotus shade, a blueberry rattan pantry cabinet, a small
dusky pink trash bin, a glossy sky blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a black plastic
tray of spider chow, a white microwave oven, Blueberry the hefty violet
feathered felo, and Mischief the large black felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.
n
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a small white trash bin, a compact red refrigerator, a clear
plastic food storage container, a blue plastic food storage container, Magellan
the arachnoid security robot, and a compact white refrigerator here.
You can go south and out.
sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.

can reach our performance goals if we try!"
A short yellow soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles abruptly
flings itself at the side of the tank, its tentacles tapping at the glass, then
it withdraws.

and a cerulean glowing interior drifts slowly across the tank.

over a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and red
aquatic life and coral rocks.

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
&"G-yFrj^%}'SfZ_[7tPevK"<Z^L#/iyJLDJ~&ia
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Hello
pilots, welcome to Belt of Orion. Remember to watch your ship's charge, have
enough EAOS credits for tolls, and most importantly, fly safe!"
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Critical Strike.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

l
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a steel plaque engraved with the phrase
"Reminder: This ship is equipped with a sensor dampening array.", a wormhole
drive tracer, a black leather captain's chair, a dark red leather captain's
chair, and a black leather sofa here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a black leather captain's chair.)

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see a steel plaque engraved with the phrase "Please only use lasers unless
otherwise directed. Thank you." and an overstuffed red chair here.

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
^m#;2\DQjFT3j`Ee@GBNV[!wAJmE7[kE7D=G$1_*
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Weapons Room Two]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on red alert. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.
You see a steel plaque engraved with the phrase "Please only use lasers unless
otherwise directed. Thank you." and an overstuffed red chair here.
You can go south and down.
I don't understand that.
la
y

FTL Interalliance Communications Network
--
Subject: Time to practice what we preach
Author: Kim Saunders
Posted: 20:01 24 November 2316 GST
--
Hello all,
Although our meeting ended rather abruptly and after a rough and serious
conversation, I generally do think it was productive. I thank everyone for
attending and for your input and cooperation.
It is time that we try to move on now. Lily has appologized for her decision not
to return home once she learned the news, and unless she gives us a new reason
to doubt the sincerity of her words, we should leave it at that. Our statement
has also made the news. For anyone who was not in the meeting, we decided to
send the following messages in our statement.
1. A message of support and condolences to the victims and their families.
2. A call for peace and understanding, a call for the AEU citizens who are
involved in these acts of violence to stop what they are doing and think things
through. The hope that we can solve differences by communicating rather than
attacking and killing people.
3. We also put our support behind the statement the League, Fringe and Mutuality
pilots released earlier, and we expressed the hope that the people responsible
will be found and brought to justice.
I know it's been a tough week, and things were said that we all may regret. I
know that even I have said things, in anger and frustration, that I probably
could have worded differently, and I appologize for this. What matters now is
that we try to find common ground again from which we can move on and work
together. How can we preach peace and understanding when we are at each other's
throats? I hope we can all let past animosities go and turn a new leaf.
Then there is another thing I would like to address. Ather, I know you are not
fond of felo and see them as tools. I am not here to start another felo
discussion. no, i am not fond of what some people do to felo, you are not the
only one. we will probably never agree on the subject. It is up to the lawyers
and other such people to define whether felo should be treated the same as all
animals, and whether mutilating and killing them is a punishable offense or not.
But it is a hot topic among pilots from all alliances. I think it is walking a
very thin line when you openly defend felo mutilation.
I agree whole heartedly with a notice I received today from the liaison office.
If we on one hand preach cooperation,love, understanding and peace, and on the
other hand publicly argue with each other, attack each other, threaten each
other or state that animal mutilation is ok, we are contradicting ourselves. It
will send a very wrong signal and will give people even less a reason to trust
us. Now, I don't know who threatened who, this was just something the liaison
mentioned. This request is addressed to us all, whether you were at the meeting
or not, and yes, it includes me as well. Let's work together towards our goal of
understanding and peace. I know we can do it!
Take care,
Kim
--

[2] Return
[3] Reply
[4] Quit

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters Block]
You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, an antique oak
table from Old Earth, a textured plasteel floor lamp with a cream shade (casting
a white-colored glow), a small purple trash bin, a small yellow ball containing
a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a
wall-sized bubbling coral pink-lit aquarium containing violet and blue aquatic
life and coral rocks, a small bubbling neon blue-lit toroidal aquarium
containing red and blue aquatic life and round rocks, a black plastic tray of
spider chow, a violet leather sectional sofa, a robotic chef named Nellie, a
hairy yellow eight-legged ArachnoPal named Higgins, Jewel the large violet
glowing felo, and Shasta the big onyx soldier felo here.
You can go north, east, south, west, up, and down.
go shower
[Starship "William Dove"; Shower]
You can go out.
**
 Welcome back to Star Conquest!
**
 Consider voting for Star Conquest at MUD listing sites! Votes help keep new
players coming to the game!
 The Mud Connector: http://www.mudconnect.com/mud-bin/vote_rank.cgi?mud=Star+Con
quest
 Top Mud Sites:     http://www.topmudsites.com/vote-sc.html
**
 TIP: Trading is the best way to make credits, if you can find the right route.
**
start
You push a small button, starting the shower. Hot water begins to pour over your
skin. You feel cleaner already.
take vinyl
You remove a small black vinyl case from a leather briefcase.
Hot, steaming water continues to bathe every inch of your skin, cleansing you as
it invigorates your senses.
take last soap
You remove an amber bar of soap embossed with a sugar maple leaf from a small
black vinyl case.
use soap
You carefully wash your body with an amber bar of soap embossed with a sugar
maple leaf.
put soap in vinyl
You put an amber bar of soap embossed with a sugar maple leaf in a small black
vinyl case.
stop
You push a small button, turning the shower off. You stand, dripping, completely
relaxed. Steam floats lazily in the enclosed space.
take oversized
You remove an oversized white towel from a small black vinyl case.
dry me with towel
You dry yourself off with an oversized white towel.
put towel in vinyl
You put an oversized white towel in a small black vinyl case.
put vinyl in briefcase
You put a small black vinyl case in a leather briefcase.
take suitcase
You remove a small suitcase from a leather briefcase.
hands
You are carrying a small suitcase in your right hand.
take briefs from suitcase
You remove a pair of white cotton briefs from a small suitcase.
wear briefs
You slide a pair of white cotton briefs on.
take cargo
You remove a pair of relaxed fit light khaki cargo pants from a small suitcase.
wear cargo
You pull a pair of relaxed fit light khaki cargo pants on over your legs.
take tee
You remove a long-sleeved black tee with a large silver starburst appliqued on
the front from a small suitcase.
wear tee
You pull a long-sleeved black tee with a large silver starburst appliqued on the
front on over your head.
take white socks
You remove a pair of white socks from a small suitcase.
wear socks
You slide a pair of white socks onto your feet.
take sneakers
You remove a pair of gray canvas sneakers from a small suitcase.
wear sneakers
You pull a pair of gray canvas sneakers onto your feet.
put suitcase in briefcase
You put a small suitcase in a leather briefcase.
out

l aquarium
a large bubbling azure blue-lit aquarium containing violet and amber aquatic
life and round rocks
This is a tank for holding critters!
It is filled with water.
It is open.
Inside it you see a white plastic undersea castle and a plastic wrecked AEU
Soothsayer.
It appears that there are ample food particles in the water.
A short violet soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles, a large
sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with rounded fins, and a small sleek
speckled violet aquatic creature with pentagonal fins are living in it.
That's three creatures, and the tank could probably safely hold twelve more.

[Starship "Unicorn"; Control Room]
This control room would look less out of place as an old atmospheric fighter
cockpit. The controls are placed so that the pilot can recline and still be able
to reach every control, as well as see out of the rounded viewport. The
nose-mounted turrets extend into the pilot's eyeline, giving the illusion that
one could aim them by eye. There is a small amount of standing room behind the
pilot's controls. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer and a black leather sofa here.
You can go south and out.

exp
Among the AEU, you have a good amount of starship combat points, not very many
aggregate points, not very many exploration points, not very many industry
points, and relatively few ground combat points.
Related to industry, you are the best with asteroid hauls, inexperienced with
Teslatown activities, very inexperienced with belt management, very
inexperienced with salvages, very inexperienced with deliveries, very
inexperienced with asteroid mining, very inexperienced with passengers, very
inexperienced with atmospheric scooping, very inexperienced with salvage
operations, and very inexperienced with trading.
Related to starship combat, you are the best at combat gunning, good with
mission-related ship kills, good at combat piloting, very inexperienced at
advanced engineering techniques, very inexperienced with minor skirmish ship
kills, very inexperienced at defending salvage operations, and very
inexperienced with invading ship kills.
Related to ground combat, you are inexperienced with weapon hits, inexperienced
with kills, and very inexperienced with ground missions.
Related to exploration, you are inexperienced with planetary finds,
inexperienced at the exploration of the Glyphmaker ruins, inexperienced with
space imaging, inexperienced with local artifact finds, inexperienced with alien
artifact finds, and very inexperienced with assisted planetary finds.

help amen
--
Star Conquest Help: Starship Amenities
--
Category: Game Systems
--
Starships possess a few minor amenities to make long trips bearable!
SHIP'S HEAD
First of all, are you out in deep space and you really need to "go"? Never fear!
All starships have a ship's head! It's conveniently located in the storage room,
simply because there is no good place to put such a thing.
Ship's heads also possess a first aid kit for use in emergencies. These are kept
stocked automatically by alliance spaceports.
LIVING QUARTERS
Living quarters are the center of most amenities, logically! Living quarters are
typically found on larger ships, and tend to be centrally attached to a "hub"
room. This hub will possess a tiny, single shower that you can GO into. It has
the usual START and STOP commands.
Also in the hub, you may CLAIM a living quarters if you have a key to the ship.
This will lock a living quarters so that only you may enter it! If you wish to
give up your room, you may UNCLAIM it later.
If you own the ship, you may OVERRIDE a living quarters lock from the hub in
order to forcibly unclaim it.
Once inside the living quarters, you may ALLOW anyone you brought with you to
also be able to get past the lock. If you change your mind, you can DISALLOW a
person.
--
override
Which living quarters would you like to override?
[1] Living Quarters One - Shule Elemmire

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a glossy gold
ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a small white trash bin,
a compact red refrigerator, a clear plastic food storage container, a blue
plastic food storage container, Magellan the arachnoid security robot, a compact
white refrigerator, Purr the humanoid service robot, and Blueberry the hefty
violet feathered felo here.
You can go south and out.

we would do something akin to what we are suggesting here.  But it's up to you
guys - this diatribe could make you quite angry and upset.
Do we post it?

I'm sure this has been said already, but thanks for the hard work to make things
more real with smells and activity. sounds maybe silly but I enjoy the fact I
need to make sure I'm not smelling like a dead rotting fish after I've just
cleaned out my aquariums, or that after I've shoveled I'm all swetty and
smelling of hard work.

[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.

Subject: Re: An Important Question
Author: nadira
Posted: Fri Nov 25 21:26:09 2016 UTC
--
Hi,
I am honestly torn here. Most of your diatribes give some good thinking
material. On the other hand, I have just settled down from being darn angry. So,
I don't know.
I am sure it is not wrong that my character gets angry from time to time, but
when I as a player get angryer than my character, ouch. then i know I am doing
something wrong.
I hope what I am saying makes some sort of sense.
--

Subject: Re: An Important Question
Author: Gordon Bjelk
Posted: Fri Nov 25 21:30:08 2016 UTC
--
It started out as a diatribe and ended up more as an in-progress breakdown. 
What you say makes sense - if a character gets angry, that's roleplaying.  If a
player gets angry, there's a problem somewhere.
But that's three of four, so I think we'll count that as a pass.
Here goes.
--

A metallic gold touch einrophone beeps quietly for attention, indicating a new
